You'll need: 4 ripe bananas 4 eggs 8 pitted dates 1/4 cup coconut oil 1/2 coconut flour 1Tbsp baking powder 1tsp cinnamon 1/2tsp nutmeg seeds from 1 pomegranate handful of walnuts   Directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees. Grease the bread baking tray with some coconut oil, half teaspoon. 2. Blend bananas, egg, coconut oil and dates. 3. Add coconut flour, cinnamon, baking powder and nutmeg. Mix in everything by hand just to combine. 4. Add walnuts and pomegranate seeds. Mix them in. 5. Pour in the bread baking tray. Put in the oven and bake for about 45min. Start checking after half an hour. The toothpick inserted in the bread should come out clean. Voila! Tastes great on its own or with some peanut butter or ice cream on top. Yum! I am off to IKEA now. Thinking about redecorating our kitchen. Since I spend so much time in it. Will see what IKEA has to offer. Have a wonderful weekend everybody! Asta <3

What a lovely Sunday! I spend my afternoon reading one of my all time favorite books: The Little Prince by Antoine de Saint-Exupery. I read this book every few years. It helps me to hold onto a sense of innocence and imagination, and not to lose myself while growing up. My favorite paragraph of the the book is this:
“Goodbye,” said the fox. “Here is my secret. It’s quite simple: One sees clearly only with the heart. Anything essential is invisible to the eyes. . . . It’s the time that you spent on your rose that makes your rose so important. . . . People have forgotten this truth,” the fox said, “But you mustn’t forget it. You become responsible for what you’ve tamed. You’re responsible for your rose. . . .”
So much wisdom in this book. We should all live by these standards. If we tell someone we love them, we must mean it. If we make a friend,  we have to be mindful of the kind of friend we are. Be kind. Be responsible. Oh, I highly recommend this book to everyone! It is a very easy and inspiring read. Why not read it on your Easter Holidays? I think it's a perfect holiday treat for yourself. Here in Norway, people read crime books and watch crime movies during Easter. It is still a mystery to me, which nobody could explain me yet. How Easter and crime are related? Well, maybe some day I'll understand it, but until then Easter for me is about dying eggs. I never really cared to much about Easter. It was never very celebrated in my family. All the celebrations and attention goes to Christmas Holidays and Easter gets kind of forgotten. But... We always do one thing during Easter. We dye eggs! And we eat them afterwards. That's all what Easter is about. At least for me. I would like to share the way we do it in my family.  It's super simple and easy and you can get yourself some nice eggs for Easter table decorations and of course consumption.
You'll need: Eggs Dry onion outer skins Old nylon stockings (washed)

The way to do it is very simple. You take an egg and cover it with onion skins.

Put the covered egg in the stocking. Tie a knot and repeat with the rest of the eggs.

When all your eggs are covered with onion skins and are placed in the stocking, put them in the pot with water. Bring to boil and cook for 10 minutes.  Let them cool down for a while and remove from the stocking. Wash under cold water and voila! Every single one of them will be unique and beautiful! Perfect decoration for your Easter table. And of course you can enjoy them as well. Just peel and eat!   Happy Upcoming Easter! Hope you have something excited planned. Don't forget to enjoy whatever you do and let your inner child play a little... Asta <3
post_title: The Little Prince and Easter Eggs

post_content:
"You see, there are still faint glimmers of civilization left in this barbaric slaughter house that was once known as humanity" - The Grand Budapest Hotel
Happy Hump Day! Hope you're having a wonderful week so far. Last night we went to the cinema to watch a new Wes Anderson movie - The Grand Budapest Hotel. I thought it was simply wonderful, funny, exciting, colorful and Brilliant! It is definitely one of the best movies I've seen so far. I literally enjoyed every single minute of it. If you haven't seen it yet, I highly recommend!   This movie reminded me of another excellent movies  by Wes Anderson - Moonrise Kingdom and Fantastic Mr. Fox. They are as well quirky, sweet, beautiful and funny. I want to watch them again! I think it's a good trio for a movie night with your friends. Charming, colorful movies which make you laugh and feel happy! If you're planning a movie night, you'll need some food, right? I suggest having tacos, because I like Mexican food.  I already posted my flax seed tacos and salsa recipes. And here goes my holy guacamole recipe. Simple, easy and super delicious! If you don't have time to make tacos, you can always use salsa and guacamole as yummy dips for chips or veggies for your movie night!

Holy Guacamoly

You'll need:

4 ripe avocados Half of red onion 1 lime Handful of cherry tomatoes Bunch of fresh coriander 1 tsp of each: salt, cumin and cayenne pepper   Directions:  1. Finely chop onion, coriander and cherry tomatoes. 2. Mash avocados with the spices, half of onions and tomatoes. Use hand masher or blender. 3. And the rest of chopped onions and tomatoes, squeeze the lime juice and mix well. I always leave some onions and tomatoes non mashed. I like some crunchy bites in my guacamole. 4. Adjust salt, pepper and lime. Voila! Enjoy on the toast, with your tacos or as a dip. Sorry, no picture of the guacamole this time. The quality was not so good. But trust me, the taste is great! Will add the picture later, the next time I make it again. It'll be soon. I love guacamole. Have a wonderful the rest of the week  my lovelies! Don't forget to be Happy! Asta
post_title: Wes Anderson movie night (+ Holy Guacamoly recipe)

post_content:
Hello Monday! I had a very relaxing weekend. Sleeping us much as I want, having dinners with friends, planning summer vacation and doing some baking. Well deserved perfect weekend. No rush, no stress, just happy times. Yesterday I made some pretty awesome, super delicious nut bars. It would be a shame not to share them with you. I had some leftover almond meal (from making almond milk). Since I don't like to throw it away, I decided to put it in a good use and make some energy bars. Ingredients and proportions were totally random. Whatever I had my kitchen cabinets. To tell you the truth, I just used different measuring cups what I thought would look good in the picture and filled them with some foods I had. Final result turned out unexpectedly awesome! I tested them on three guys yesterday and they all were impressed. They thought I bought them in the store. Couldn't believe that I made them myself. That's how good they are! Here comes the recipe:

Hemp protein energy nut bars

1 cup almond meal Half cup oats 1/4 cup hemp protein powder 1/4 cup melted coconut oil 4 Tbsp date syrup 1Tbsp chia seeds 1 Tbsp grounded flax seeds 1/2 cup walnuts (chopped) Handful of goji berries Handful of dried cranberries Not in the picture: 200g of dark chocolate (at least 70% cacao). Shredded coconut chips (for decoration, optional)
Directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees. 2. Mix all ingredients until everything combines and gets wet. It should look like a wet crumble. 3. Place everything in the baking form. I used 25cm round silicon baking form. If you are using not silicon baking form, firstly rub some coconut oil on the pan or use baking paper. Press everything well to the bottom of the pan. 4. Bake for about 25min until the "cake" dries and the surface becomes brown. 5. Let it cool down for 20minutes. Meanwhile melt 100g of the chocolate.  6. Pour the chocolate on the cooled nut bars cake and spread it using spatula. Set in the fridge for 15min. Meanwhile melt the rest of the chocolate (100g). 7. Take out the cake from the fridge. Put a baking paper on top of the cake and flip it over. Pour the rest of the melted chocolate on the "bottom" of the cake. Sprinkle with coconut. Set back to the fridge for a half an hour. 8. Take out the cake from the fridge and cut in desirable pieces. I made 16 small energy bars. Enjoy!
post_title: Dark chocolate covered, hemp protein boosted energy nut bars

1 cup almond meal Half cup oats 1/4 cup hemp protein powder 1/4 cup melted coconut oil 4 Tbsp date syrup 1Tbsp chia seeds 1 Tbsp grounded flax seeds 1/2 cup walnuts (chopped) Handful of goji berries Handful of dried cranberries Not in the picture: 200g of dark chocolate (at least 70% cacao). Shredded coconut chips (for decoration, optional)

Directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees. 2. Mix all ingredients until everything gets wet. It should look like a wet crumble. 3. Place everything in the baking form. I used 15cm round silicon baking form. If you are using not silicon baking form, firstly rub some coconut oil on the pan or use baking paper. Press everything well to the bottom of the pan. 4. Bake for about 25min until it dries and the surface becomes brown. 5. Let it cool down for 20minutes. Meanwhile melt 100g of the chocolate. 6. Pour the chocolate on the cooled nut bars cake and spread it using spatula. Set in the fridge for 15min. Meanwhile melt the rest of the chocolate (100g). 7. Take out the cake from the fridge. Put a baking paper on top of the cake and flip it over. Pour the rest of the melted chocolate on the "bottom" of the cake. Sprinkle with coconut. Set back to the fridge for a half an hour. 8. Take out the cake from the fridge and cut in desirable shapes. I made 16 small energy bars. Enjoy!
post_title: Dark chocolate covered, hemp protein boosted energy nut bars

post_content:
What a lovely Sunday! I spend my afternoon reading one of my all time favorite books: The Little Prince by Antoine de Saint-Exupery. So much wisdom about friendship and love in just a few pages. I love it! I read this book every few years.  It helps me to hold onto a sense of innocence and imagination, and not lose myself as I grow up. My favorite paragraph of the the book is this:
“Goodbye,” said the fox. “Here is my secret. It’s quite simple: One sees clearly only with the heart. Anything essential is invisible to the eyes. . . . It’s the time that you spent on your rose that makes your rose so important. . . . People have forgotten this truth,” the fox said, “But you mustn’t forget it. You become responsible for what you’ve tamed. You’re responsible for your rose. . . .”
If you tell someone you love them, you must mean it. If you make a friend, always be mindful of the kind of friend you are. Be aware. Be kind. Be responsible.
post_title: Easy way to dye your Easter eggs
Processed with VSCOcam with f2 preset
Processed with VSCOcam with m3 preset
Processed with VSCOcam with m3 preset

post_content:
What a lovely Sunday! I spend my afternoon reading one of my all time favorite books: The Little Prince by Antoine de Saint-Exupery. I read this book every few years. It helps me to hold onto a sense of innocence and imagination, and not to lose myself while growing up. My favorite paragraph of the the book is this:
“Goodbye,” said the fox. “Here is my secret. It’s quite simple: One sees clearly only with the heart. Anything essential is invisible to the eyes. . . . It’s the time that you spent on your rose that makes your rose so important. . . . People have forgotten this truth,” the fox said, “But you mustn’t forget it. You become responsible for what you’ve tamed. You’re responsible for your rose. . . .”
So much wisdom in this book. We should all live by these standards. If we tell someone we love them, we must mean it. If we make a friend,  we have to be mindful of the kind of friend we are. Be kind. Be responsible. Oh, I highly recommend this book to everyone! It is a very easy and inspiring read. Why not read it on your Easter Holidays? I think it's a perfect holiday treat for yourself. Here in Norway, people read crime books and watch crime movies during Easter. It's still a mystery to me, nobody could explain to me how Easter and crime are related. Well, maybe some day I'll understand it, but until then Easter for me is about dying eggs. I never really cared to much about Easter. It was never very celebrated in my family. All the celebrations and attention goes to Christmas Holidays and Easter gets kind of forgotten. But... We always do one thing during Easter. We dye eggs! It is very common in all the Easter Europe. I would to share the way we do it in my family.  It's super simple and easy and you can get yourself some nice eggs for Easter table decorations and of course consumption. You'll need: Eggs Onion outer skins Old nylon stockings (washed)

I never really cared to much about Easter. It was never very celebrated in my family. All the celebrations and attention goes to Christmas Holidays and Easter gets kind of forgotten. But... We always do one thing during Easter. We dye eggs! It is very common in all the Easter Europe. I would to share the way we do it in my family.  It's super simple and easy and you can get yourself some nice eggs for Easter table decorations and of course consumption.
You'll need: Eggs Onion outer skins Old nylon stockings (washed)
post_title: The Little Prince and Easter Eggs

You become responsible for what you’ve tamed. You’re responsible for your rose. . . .”
So much wisdom in this book. We should all live by these standards. If we tell someone we love them, we must mean it. If we make a friend,  we have to be mindful of the kind of friend we are. Be kind. Be responsible. Oh, I highly recommend this book to everyone! It is a very easy and inspiring read. Why not read it on your Easter Holidays? I think it's a perfect holiday treat for yourself. Here in Norway, people read crime books and watch crime movies during Easter. It's still a mystery to me, nobody could explain to me how Easter and crime are related. Well, maybe some day I'll understand it, but until then Easter for me is about dying eggs. I never really cared to much about Easter. It was never very celebrated in my family. All the celebrations and attention goes to Christmas Holidays and Easter gets kind of forgotten. But... We always do one thing during Easter. We dye eggs! It is very common in all the Easter Europe. I would to share the way we do it in my family.  It's super simple and easy and you can get yourself some nice eggs for Easter table decorations and of course consumption.
You'll need: Eggs Dry onion outer skins Old nylon stockings (washed)

The way to dye eggs is very simple. You take an egg and cover it with onion skins.

Put the covered egg in the stocking. Tie a knot and repeat with the rest of the eggs.

When all your eggs are covered with onion skins and are placed in the stocking, put them in the pot with water. Bring to boil and cook for 10 minutes.  Let them cool down for a while and remove from the stocking. Wash under cold water and enjoy! Every single one of them will be unique and beautiful! Perfect decoration for your Easter table. And of course you can eat them as well!
post_title: The Little Prince and Easter Eggs

post_content:
It's been so long since my last post. Two weeks!!! I know it's not the right way to do it, since I just started blogging. The truth is I needed some web/online detox. I think I was spending too much time on Instagram. Looking through all these beautiful, yummy food pictures is not only inspiring, but it is time consuming as well. Therefore the last few weeks were less internet and more quality time with my love.Now I am back online again with full speed and new ideas! I spend my Easter holidays in Tuscany! This place is amazing: super cute little hill towns, yummy foods, delicious wines. What else can one wish for, right? I really want to go back there. Some day I will. Now I am looking forward for my summer vacation in Sicily! Time to start planning. Any advices, restaurant suggestions? The last week has been amazing in Oslo, sunny and warm. We started to spend our afternoons on the balcony. I love having a balcony. If it is sunny outside, you can always find us there. Reading, studying, chilling, having dinner or a glass of wine, or everything at the same time. Did I tell you, that I love grilling? If not, please do know, that soon many grilling recipes will be coming your way. We got a gass grill last year for the balcony and we use it a lot! This year we opened the grilling season just a few days ago. And I already have my new favorite dish! Grilled sweet potato with pickled onion, lime juice and fresh coriander. Just writing about it makes me hungry. Trust me, it's super delicious! Give it a try. It can be a great appetizer or a side dish for your summer party. Here goes very simple recipe:
You'll need: Sweet potatotoes 1/4 cup of Olive oil Salt, pepper 2 Limes Bunch of Fresh Coriander Pickled red onions(made in adcance)
Directions: Peel the sweet potatoes and slice them 1cm wide. I used three big ones, it was enough for 3 persons to snack on as an appetizer. Coat them with salt, pepper and 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Heat your grill on medium and put the potatoes on. I grilled them about 6min on each side. While they are grilling quickly make the dressing. Mix the rest of the olive oil with the juices of two limes. Chop the fresh coriander. Get your pickled onions. When the sweet potatoes are done and have grill lines, remove them from the fire and coat with olive oil/lime mixture. Then take one by one, put a few onion rings on top, sprinkle with fresh coriander and enjoy! Please let me know, if you would like me to share my pickled onions recipe. It's pretty basic, just red onions, vinegar, water, salt and some palm sugar. Have a lovely week everybody! Cheers, Asta

Sometimes it is good to be alone and reflect on life. Everybody has to have some "Me" time once in a while. Today is My day. I have a day off, my Love is at work, so I can do whatever I want. I know that I HAVE so many things on my chores list. BUT everything can wait. Today is about ME and what I WANT to do. I had a perfect lazy morning with a few cups of coffee, oatmeal and silly girly tv shows. It is so good sometimes to do nothing, right? I had so much time to think and reflect on my life. I have a job which I like and which helps me build my future in the direction where I see myself going. I know quite a few inspiring people who help me grow as well. And I have the best boyfriend ever who supports me in everything I do. Days like this make me realize how blessed I am. I am Healthy, Happy and Loved! And I still have inner  innocent child inside me who sees only the best in people and sometimes likes to play. What else can one ask for, right? Next on my "Me Day" is to make some yummy goodies in the kitchen, because it is my favorite place in our apartment. Kitchen experiments are the best therapy for me. Cooking cheers me up, lifts me up, relaxes and calms me. Have no idea what I am going to make yet. Need to check my cabinets for some ingredients. I feel like making something sweet... Will let you know on my next post  how it turned out. Before I go back to Me Time, I would like to share my last kitchen experiments. I made some yummy sweet treats from leftover almond meal. They turned out pretty good. Though I feel that there is room for improvement, so the next time I have some almond meal, I'll try to do them again. Until then, here goes my .....

Drunk Marzipan Chocolates

You'll need: 1.5 cups almond meal (leftovers from makinf almond meal) 2Tbsp coconut sugar 1 shot glass of Cointreeau 25g of cacao butter 100g of very dark chocolate + 1Tbsp coconut oil (optional) a handful of walnuts (optional)   Directions: 1. Melt cacao butter (I used microwave) 2. Mix almond meal with sugar, melted cacao butter and cointreau. 3. Make small balls and put them on plate covered with baking tray. The batter will be quite wet, but that is ok. When you are finished, put all the balls in the freezer for 10-15 minutes. 4. While the balls are freezing, melt the dark chocolate. I like to 1Tbsp of coconut oil to the melted chocolate. It makes the chocolate more liquid. 5. Take out the marzipan balls from the freezer. Now you can correct the shapes (if you did not manage to make them perfectly round before). Then  one by one dip them in the melted chocolate and put on the baking paper to dry. Use the fork to take out marzipan balls from the chocolate. Decorate with walnut on top. 6. When all the mazipans are covered, put them back to the freezer for 10-15min to dry and become solid. Take out form the freezer and enjoy! Holds best in the fridge. Mine lasted only one day. They are crazy delicious!   Happy Hump Day lovely people! Find time for yourself ;) Asta

I have a job which I like and which helps me build my future in the direction where I see myself going. I know quite a few inspiring people who help me grow as well. And I have a best boyfriend ever who supports me in everything I do. Days like this make me realize how blessed I am. I am Healthy, Happy and Loved! And I still have inner  innocent child inside me who sees only the best in people and sometimes likes to play. What else can one ask for, right? Next on my "Me Day" is to make some yummy goodies in the kitchen, because it is my favorite place in our apartment. Kitchen experiments are the best therapy for me. Have no idea what I am going to make yet. Need to check my cabinets for some ingredients. I feel like making something sweet... Will let you know on my next post  how it turned out. Before I go back to Me Time, I would like to share my last kitchen experiments. I made some yummy sweet treats from leftover almond meal. They turned out pretty good. Though I feel that there is room for improvement, so the next time I have some almond meal, I'll try to do them again. Until then, here goes my Drunk Marzipan Chocolates.

And I still have inner  innocent child inside me who sees only the best in people and sometimes likes to play. What else can one ask for, right? Have no idea what I am going to make yet. Need to check my cabinets for some ingredients. I feel like making something sweet... Will let you know on my next post  how it turned out. Before I go back to Me Time, I would like to share my last kitchen experiments. I made some yummy sweet treats from leftover almond meal. They turned out pretty good. Though I feel that there is room for improvement, so the next time I have some almond meal, I'll try to do them again. Until then, here goes my Drunk Marzipan Chocolates. You'll need: 1.5 cups almond meal (leftovers from makinf almond meal) 2Tbsp coconut sugar 1 shot glass of Cointreeau 25g of cacao butter 100g of very dark chocolate + 1Tbsp coconut oil (optional) a handful of walnuts (optional) Directions: 1. Melt cacao butter (I used microwave) 2. Mix almond meal with sugar, melted cacao butter and cointreau. 3. Make small balls and put them on plate covered with baking tray. The batter will be quite wet, but that is ok. When you are finished, put all the balls in the freezer for 10-15 minutes. 4. While the balls are freezing, melt the dark chocolate. I like to 1Tbsp of coconut oil to the melted chocolate. It makes the chocolate more liquid. 5. Take out the marzipan balls from the freezer. Now you can correct the shapes (if you did not manage to make them perfectly round before). Then  one by one dip them in the melted chocolate and put on the baking paper to dry. Use the fork to take out marzipan balls from the chocolate. Decorate with walnut on top. 6. When all the mazipans are covered, put them back to the freezer for 10-15min to dry and become solid. Take out form the freezer and enjoy! Holds best in the fridge. Mine lasted only one day. They are crazy delicious!

Happy Hump Day! I had a pretty good week since my last post. Last weekend there was a relay race (Holmenkollen stafetten) and I participated in it. My boyfriend's company lacked a few people. So I stepped in. For a free t-shirt and dinner afterwards.  Jokes aside, I was really happy that they offered to me. I love such events. It feels like all the people of Oslo are outside. Everybody are either running or cheering. Love happy vibes in the air. My part was 370m, but I gave all myself in and ran like somebody was trying to catch me. I don't think I ever ran as fast. I was pooped afterwards. But happy! 370m in 71s. Pretty proud of myself ! Afterwards we went for some Indian food to Gandhi. It was amazing! I can never get enough of Indian food. Recently I starting making granola and I am loving it! You can get really creative and mix whatever ingredients you have at the moment. Usually it turns out great. Let me share with you my basic granola recipe. It was the first one I made and it tasted absolutely divine. And the smell of roasted nuts... I am inlove!

Basic Granola

You'll need: 1 cup oats 2Tbsp coconut oil 3tsp date syrup or honey 1tsp cinnamon 1/4 cup each: walnuts, almonds, sunflower seeds, flaxseeds, dried mulberries, coconut flakes, goji berries A few drops of vanilla essence Directions: 1. Melt coconut oil with date syrup. 2. Set mulberries, goji and coconut aside. In a bowl add chopped nuts, oats, seeds and cinnamon,  pour melted coconut oil and mix everything well. 3. Spread the mixture on the baking tray (covered with baking paper). 4. Bake for 20min in the 170 degrees oven. Mix granola every 5min, so it doesn't get burned. It will become a little brownish and will start smelling like heaven, 5. Remove granola from the oven, mix in berries with coconut and enjoy! Tastes great on its own, poured over yogurt, ice-cream or smoothie. Yum! Hope you'll give it a try! Now I'm experimenting  with adding some superfood powders to granola. Will share my best results soon! Have a lovely the rest of the week! Cheers, Asta
